message.content:
I need to calculate several financial ratios based on the given financial statements. Let me work through each ratio step by step.

### 1. Current Ratio
Current Ratio = Total Current Assets / Total Current Liabilities
Current Ratio = $29,413,723.95 / $8,028,630.43 = 3.66

### 2. Gross Profit Margin
Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%
Gross Profit Margin = ($8,372,608.70 / $28,572,608.70) × 100% = 29.30%

### 3. Debt to Asset Ratio
Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets
Total Liabilities = $8,028,630.43 (only current liabilities are present)
Debt to Asset Ratio = $8,028,630.43 / $39,772,748.32 = 0.20

### 4. Net Profit Margin
Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%
Net Profit Margin = ($3,744,117.89 / $28,572,608.70) × 100% = 13.10%

### 5. Cash to Current Debt Ratio
Cash to Current Debt Ratio = (Cash on Hand + Bank Deposits) / Total Current Liabilities
Cash to Current Debt Ratio = ($6,057,264.53 + $1,020,005.47) / $8,028,630.43 = $7,077,270.00 / $8,028,630.43 = 0.88

### 6. Free Cash Flow (FCF)
Free Cash Flow = Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities - Capital Expenditures
FCF = -$10,442,735.47 - $2,479,994.53 = -$12,922,730.00
(This matches the "Net Increase" value in the cash flow statement)

### 7. Return on Assets (ROA)
ROA = (Net Profit / Total Assets) × 100%
ROA = ($3,744,117.89 / $39,772,748.32) × 100% = 9.41%

```json
{"solution": {'Current Ratio': '3.66', 'Gross Profit Margin': '29.30%', 'Debt to Asset Ratio': '0.20', 'Net Profit Margin': '13.10%', 'Cash to Current Debt Ratio': '0.88', 'Free Cash Flow (FCF)': '-12922730.00', 'Return on Assets (ROA)': '9.41%'} }
```
